Hello there, thanks for stopping by.

I am a developer, filmmaker, preservationist, and technologist living in Chicago.

Currently, I'm the Digital Preservation Specialist at the University of Chicago, where I contribute to UChicagoNode, an integrated digital collections platform that brings together digital materials across the University's library's collections. Additionally, I co-chair the International Image Interoperability Framework (IIIF) Audio/Video Community Group.

Previously, I’ve worked in digital preservation, film restoration, and media preservation at institutions including the Asian Film Archive, City University of New York Television (CUNY TV), and the J. Paul Getty Trust. I’ve also completed internships at Bay Area Video Coalition, Cineric Inc., Internet Archive, New York Public Library, and Prelinger Archives while earning my M.A. in Moving Image Archiving and Preservation at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts.

Originally from sunny Singapore, I enjoy grocery shopping, sailing, and the smell of fresh bread.
